channel.title: IM a Noob XD 317 (run.bat problem)
channel.description:
hey, im starting a server with a friend just to mess around on learn java alittle bit.. and im having a run error that says
'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .
This is what my run.bat looks like
@echo off title Enrisep-Rsps is waiting you. java -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar;-server -XX:+AggressiveHeap -XX:MaxHeapFreeRatio=90 -XX:MinHeapFreeRatio=90 -XX:+DisableExplicitGC -XX:+RelaxAccessControlCheck -XX:+UseParallelGC -XX:CompileThreshold=1 -XX:ThreadStackSize=128 server.Server pause
Just Need some simple help, and i figured this is the best community to help me

item.title: IM a Noob XD 317 (run.bat problem)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:6, topic:538256”]Isn’t 7.0.45 the most recent one…?

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk7-downloads-1880260.html[/quote]
It probably is. I probably got it confused with 25, as that’s the only other version in my files. My bad.

Read full topic

item.title: IM a Noob XD 317 (run.bat problem)
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

Isn’t 7.0.45 the most recent one…?

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk7-downloads-1880260.html

Read full topic

item.title: IM a Noob XD 317 (run.bat problem)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

An alternate solution to what Dan said, you can change the word “java” with the path to your JDK path. It would look similar to:

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_45\bin\java.exe”
“Program Files” is highlighted green because if you have a 64 bit computer and downloaded 32 bit java (this one usually automatically downloads) it would be located in “Program Files (x86)”
“jdk1.7.0_45” - the most important factor here. You’re going to want to make sure the numbers are correct with your most recent version of jdk. You should at least have 7.0_45. That one is still considered outdated, but it isn’t bad.

Read full topic

item.title: IM a Noob XD 317 (run.bat problem)
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“F A Y D, post:3, topic:538256”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=657084.msg4396003#msg4396003 date=1389136409]
You must set your environment variable for java.

http://support.microsoft.com/kb/310519
[/quote]

do you have team viewer because i dont understand how that works… i tried it or atleast attemptedto try adding a no variable for java[/quote]
Just use an IDE you won’t get these problems and they help a lot when programming.

Read full topic

Press any key to continue . . .

title Enrisep-Rsps is waiting you.
